medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute pain in the left flank.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced acute left flank pain suddenly while bicycling at approximately 6 a.m. on the day of admission. The pain was localized, without radiation, and increased in intensity from 3 to 8 on a scale of 0 to 10 over the next 7 hours.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Hodgkinâ€™s lymphoma 15 years earlier, treated with chemotherapy and radiation, which led to hypothyroidism. Other conditions include migraines, hyperlipidemia (type IIA), biapical pulmonary fibrosis, and pulmonary sarcoidosis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had breast cancer, and both mother and a maternal aunt had coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: Married, works in an office, maintains a high-fiber, low-fat diet, exercises, drinks alcohol in moderation, and does not smoke.
